Description of incident: The names, addresses, and              Social Security numbers of potentially millions of registered voters              in Ohio were included on CD-ROMs distributed to 20 political campaign              operations for spring primary election races. The records of about              7.7 million registered voters are listed on the CDs, but it's unknown              how many records contained Social Security numbers, which were not supposed to have been              included on the CDs. UPDATE (9/15/06):             A news report said that some Social Security numbers still remain on the agency's Web              site.
